revised_title: Conservation and Ecology of the Endangered Aldabran Brush Warbler
tldr: The Aldabran brush warbler, a rare bird endemic to Aldabra Atoll, was studied over a two-year period. The species is found in dense mixed scrub vegetation and is very patchily distributed. With an estimated population size below 25 individuals, conservation measures are discussed to ensure the survival of this endangered species.
